intro: Varthemia corymbulosa, commonly known as the clustered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with a mat-forming growth habit, featuring dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, succulent stems and leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Varthemia corymbulosa is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
